intro: Coreopsis involucrata, commonly known as the narrowleaf coreopsis, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant has linear, grass-like leaves and grows in a variety of habitats, including prairies and open woodlands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Coreopsis involucrata is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
